hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After Stress Events
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >15% drawdown within 5 days (stress event) followed by a 48-hour period of compressed volatility (HV20 < 30%), a long position will capture a mean reversion bounce of 8-12% within the next 5 trading days as liquidity returns to fill the gap.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Post-crash liquidity vacuums create oversold conditions. When volatility compresses after extreme moves, it signals panic exhaustion. Market makers and institutional desks systematically re-enter to capture the spread between spot and fair value, creating predictable bounce patterns.
entry_conditions: Funding rates neutral or slightly negative (< -0.001%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% gain from entry or return to 20-day VWAP (whichever comes first)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 5% loss from entry or new 5-day low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If entry triggers are met but BTC continues to decline >10% without mean reversion bounce within 5 days across 3+ independent stress events.
